title: League of legends causes my headset to crackle
body: Hi, im using a Sennheiser G4ME ZERO headset with a Soundblaster Z soundcard. I have determined at the very least it is not my headset, since when i plug in earbuds it does the same thing. I am 99% sure its not the soundcard. They only crackle when i play league, and its at random points. I cant find anything common going on when it starts. When it does start, i have to tell my soundcard to shoot the sound to the speakers (which i dont have) and then tell it to shoot the sound through my headset again. this fixes it, but its only temporary. No other game causes the crackling. Any suggestions?

Hey All Day Tay Tay, 

The most likely solution to this problem is to reinstall League of Legends following the below steps. 
Please follow this guide carefully:

- Reinstalling LoL Guide: http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176

I recommend that you take care to ensure the following:

- Verify that you are installing to this directory (it is the default one): C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\

- Make sure to perform the optional step of removing Adobe Air.

- Verify that you have acquired all available windows updates:http://www.update.microsoft.com
